page.title: 01A BLOCK FROM THE HIGHLANDS
page.content: This block is part of the Western Scottish Highlands, comprising Glencoe and the mountains rising on its north side. Across these mountains runs an ancient path from the Glencoe valley, eventually to reach Kinlockleven, fifteen miles away. Only part is in this block. The Glencoe sector of the path to very steep so basheen zig-zagged to help the traveller. This is the devils staircase. To each side of the path the peaks are: Srona Choire, Odhair-bhig, Beins Bheag, Stob Mhic Mhartuin and Stob Beins a Chralaide. At the Glencoe end of the path is the A82, the only road in the block. The river Coupall runs parallel to this road. There are three buildings in this section, all on the A82. Two were original crofts, one now being a house and the other a barn. There is one present-day house.
